SENT.plain: Antiphospholipid syndrome is a multisystem auto-immune disorder characterized by thrombotic events and the presence of circulating antiphospholipid antibodies
Large vessel involvement in the form of thrombosis/stenosis and thrombotic microangiopathy is a commonly described renal finding
However, non-thrombotic glomerulopathies are increasingly being recognized in patients with antiphospholipid syndrome
We report a rare occurrence of both renal vein thrombosis and membranous nephropathy in a previously healthy adolescent male
Investigations revealed persistently positive antiphospholipid antibodies in the absence of an underlying systemic autoimmune disorder or malignancy
Our patient responded favourably to anti-proteinuric therapy and anticoagulation with complete resolution of proteinuria and a nearly occlusive thrombus
